name: New Orient Hotel

reviews.text: Nice little hotel. The service was great, breakfast was really nice, worth the 9 euros and the lady's serving it were lovely. The hotel was in the centre of Paris but a bit out of the middle. We walked everywhere though, so it is possible. The metro is also just a minute down the road so you could take that too. The room itself was sweet and clean but small, I did expect that though. We couldn't put our suitcases anywhere except down the side of the bed but we made it work. We also did get the smallest room so you get what you pay for! I was happy overall with the hotel though and would definitely stay again.
reviews.title: Cosy hotel, very clean and great service

reviews.text: Like many others we chose the hotel based on TripAdvisor reviews. The hotels I stayed in during a trip to France the year before were 3-star and 4-star but neither came close to the New Orient! The personal service and genuine warmth of the staff, and especially Catherine and Josef Wehrle of course, made the experience exceptional.
reviews.title: Perfect for a Parisian adventure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They replied all my emails promptly and kindly answered all my questions.
reviews.title: Pretty good

reviews.text: We arrived very early on a wet morning after a long flight from Asia. When Monsieur Josef informed us our room was ready I really could have hugged him! Check in was the easiest ever and a hot shower was the perfect way to start our adventure in Paris. The weather also cleared up beautifully.
reviews.title: A Quintessential Parisian Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: New Orient gave us the chance to feel like we lived in a Parisian neighbourhood. The room was cosy, comfortable and most importantly clean. The balcony gave us the opportunity to watch the world go by. The stations Europe and Gare Saint Lazare made travelling further afield very easy. We basically walked to all the major sites on the first day. Villiers is a great option after a long day walking as the hotel is downhill from the station.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel in fabulous location!

reviews.text: This is an inexpensive (relatively) hotel that feels somewhat like a Bed and Breakfast. It is in a Paris neighborhood and you see Parisians who live in the area all the time. It was clean and simple. Frankly the bathrooms were spotless - much better than many, many other places. The rooms are not spacious but that was fine as we were out and about almost all day during our visit. The beds were comfortable and the staff was helpful. We found that it was well located and we were able to walk to wherever we wanted to go (we did walk 8-12 miles each day). Across the street is a small market and there is a bakery down the street. Don't miss dinner at Le Coin which is around the corner - it feels very local (menus on a chalkboard and no english translation but the owners are very welcoming!).
reviews.title: Just as the reviews indicated

reviews.text: My wife, son (10), and I stayed at the New Orient from July 2 to 7, 2012, and we had a very nice experience. It is a very clean and nicely furnished hotel with a very friendly and helpful staff. I enjoyed the fact that it is not located in the midst of all of the hustle and bustle of the Paris tourist areas, but is so close to three metro stations that one can get most anywhere in town in under 20 minutes. Our room (room 2 on the first floor) looked out onto Rue de Constantinople, which is a moderately busy street, but the windows of the room are so well sound proofed that we hardly heard any road noise at all. The beds are very comfortable, and the bathroom is nice with a great shower (no pressure or temperature issues at all). While the room was somewhat small (as most in Europe are, when compared to American hotels), there was plenty of space for our copious luggage.
reviews.title: Nice, quiet hotel in Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did not eat breakfast at the hotel, but rather chose to go to a bakery very close by. There are two within a two minute walk, as well as a sushi place, a pizza and pasta restaurant, multiple cafes and restaurants, and a kebab stand very near by. There is even a little grocery store directly across the street, which was handy for stocking up on snacks (unfortunately, there is no refrigerator in the room). There is a laundromat across the street as well.
reviews.title: Very Parisian, easy Metro access

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were all very nice, helping with our luggage, recommending restaurants, getting taxis, and helping find airline information for us.
reviews.title: This hotel has it all!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, I'd highly recommend this hotel and will not hesitate to stay there again.
reviews.title: Loved the little hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 6 nights, July 7-14, and were very happy with our hotel choice--which was based solely on TripAdvisor feedback. We chose a room with a balcony, and although a bit smaller in size and noisier from the street neither was a problem. A wall mounted TV was included, as was A/C and an armoire. A small in room refridgerator would have been perfect, but space was at a premium as it was.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, great location, fabulous staff.

reviews.text: The hotel desk staff were always very cheerful and patient with our rudimentary French, and they were helpful with local cafe and dinner recommendations.
reviews.title: Simply magic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are several Metro stations close by, a market area open daily with fresh bread, produce and more, plus several restaurants, cafes, and brasseries. (Also a very convenient small market store across the street, that is so small it took us a few days to notice it.)
reviews.title: Loved New Orient Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our first time in Paris and this hotel was simply amazing! Made our trip THAT much better - staff are so friendly and welcoming. I went down at 03h00 to get water and the front desk was all smiles and supplied me with a bottle of water! Certainly much more than 2* service! The rooms are lovely and we got a street view which was really nice (room 14) and with the window closed you cannot hear ANYTHING from the outside, simply amazing.
reviews.title: Wonderful staff, nice hotel

reviews.text: Will definitely go back to this hotel next time we're in Paris :)
reviews.title: First Trip to Paris - and great choice for hotel

reviews.text: Hotel: lovely small hotel. Comfortable and welcoming lobby.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, amazing staff, great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room: nicely done. I had a single which was small but very good value at 100 euros per night and it had a double bed which was great. However, the bathroom really was too small. There was just no room in the shower and the shower curtain sticks to your back!
reviews.title: Perfect Place to Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location: in a very nice area and quite central. It is not in the thick of it but you can walk to all the main attractions and there are a number of Metro stations within minutes of the hotel. There are also lots of lovely restaurants and cafes within a minute or two.
reviews.title: A gem in Paris
A true little gem
reviews.text: Staff: amazing. Nothing was too much trouble and they were friendly and welcoming. Perfect.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall: for the price this hotel is great. It is cosy and welcoming and a great place to stay in Paris.
reviews.title: Great place stay in Paris

description: This elegant, charming 2-star Hausmann style hotel,in the 8th district, a quiet and central residential area, near 2 metro lines, will allow you to discover Paris at your own pace: Opéra, Madeleine, Champs-Elysées, Montmartre, Place Clichy, Batignolles. Catherine,Josef Wehrle and their team will welcome you in a friendly atmosphere offering you a quality service in this famous district, centre for musicians from all over the world, near the Paris Conservatoire de Musique.ENTIRELY NON SMOKING AND AIR CONDITIONED
